go_data.justification: Galphaq is part of the heterotrimeric G proteins that couple to receptors such as TXA2 and thrombin receptors.
Galphaq-deficient platelets show altered coupling of thrombin and TXA2 receptors to G proteins, affecting downstream signaling.
Galphaq is implicated in the regulation of platelet shape change through its interaction with TXA2 and thrombin receptors.
Galphaq is an alpha-subunit of a heterotrimeric G protein, which has intrinsic GTPase activity.
